p.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; text-align: left;

span.span: District Closure Information and Community Updates from Dr. Farley:

span.br: March 20, 2020 - Please see the letter to Parents and Guardians from Dr. Farley, Chief School Administrator/Principal, regarding updated School Closure Information.

br.span: 24 Hour Public Hotline - 1-800-222-1222 Trained healthcare professionals are available to answer your questions about Coronavirus. The call is free.

span.style: font-size: large; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

a.style: font-size: large; color: rgb(17, 85, 204); font-family: arial, sans-serif;
a.title: click here

span.span: members can call with questions regarding symptoms and testing. It is staffed by clinical personnel at Hunterdon Medical Center in Flemington, NJ. The hotline number is 908-788-6640 and will be open seven days a week from 8:00 a.m. – 8:00 p.m.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

strong.br: Regular Board Meeting with 2020-2021 Public Budget Hearing - April 28, 2020

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-family: Tahoma, sans-serif;

span.span: that the Regular Meeting with 2020-2021 Public Budget Hearing of the Bethlehem Township Board of Education will be held virtually instead of live, due to the state of emergency declared in regard to the dangers posed by COVID-19. The meeting will be held as previously scheduled on Tuesday, April 28, 2020 at 6:30 p.m. The agenda will include, as always, a public comment section. The meeting will be broadcast via conference call. To participate in the meeting call 1-910-758-0419, use Pin: 573 203 460# and you may email your comments to the board president at
The email must include the sender’s name and address and/or the group they represent. Public comments will be read into the audio record.

div.span: Welcome to the Board of Education - Allison L. Isola, PhD. Dr. Isola is also joining the Curriculum and Policy Committees of the board.

span.br:
Parent/Guardian information about New Jersey Student Learning Assessments - Spring NJSLA Testing has been canceled.

Yearbook: click here for information flyer
*******************************************************

br.span: The mission of the Bethlehem Township School District is to provide each student a comprehensive education in a safe, supportive environment that promotes social and emotional learning, self-discipline, and motivation to achieve their potential. The Bethlehem Township School District partners with parents and the community to assist our students in developing skills to become independent and self-sufficient adults who will succeed and contribute responsibly in a global community.

To get the latest weather information - click
on the weatherbug icon above for the link
to our district's WeatherBug Station located
at Conley School.
